cyclone.name: BONNIE
cyclone.current_location: about 120 miles SE of Beaufort, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to drift north toward the central South Carolina coast Sunday, then turn slowly northeast paralleling the North Carolina coast and move offshore of the mid-Atlantic coast late Wednesday into Thursday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just north of Charleston, South Carolina

weather_observation.watch_coast: Savannah River GA to Little River Inlet SC (watch/warning area well south of Virginia)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Savannah River GA to Little River Inlet SC – Tropical Storm Warning
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Coasts of GA, SC, NC, and the southern Mid-Atlantic including southeastern Virginia
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤13%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; breezy with occasional gusts early-to-mid week.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the Virginia ports given the weak, offshore-passing system.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of rain possible Tuesday night–Wednesday as the storm’s remnant moisture moves northeast.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents along Virginia Beach and possible minor coastal flooding during high-tide cycles.
